alert.note: Alert for Bedford (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 8:42PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace affecting Bedford County. For the Other Area Rivers...including Wartrace, Vernon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Wartrace Creek near Wartrace. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate Winette Ayers Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet and rising. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbank. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 245 PM CST.
